concept.title: Creating an Item Class for Direct Debit
concept.abstract:
Direct Debit subscription items inherit attributes set up on the related Item Class record.
First, navigate to the eStore app and click the Item Classes tab. Click New. Next, enter the Name of the Item Class and identify the Business Group via the lookup field. Optionally, enter a Description.
Configure Item Class Attributes
Is Subscription (Required)
Is Direct Debit Enabled (Required)
Enable Assignments (Enable Online Assignment Management)
Require Assignments (Enable Online Assignment Management)
Tax Locale
Is Taxable (may deselect on the Item)
Is Shippable (may deselect on the Item)
Supports VAT Taxes and Shippable Subscription (fees): Is Taxable / Is Shippable must be enabled on the Item Class to be enabled on the Item, but there is an option to disable the Taxable flag on the Item.
Lastly, check the Is Active checkbox and click Save.
The Price Rule determines the amount of each payment. This amount is withdrawn from the customer’s bank account at the frequency designated on the subscription plan, until the agreement end date. The subscription plan(s) is assigned as a price attribute on the Price Rule for the appropriate payment amount.
Known Issues
Currently, additional attributes cannot be added (“AND”) when a subscription plan(s) is used as a Price Attribute. This means that a price rule cannot support additional price variables. For example: Badge Types, Subscription Plans, Filter Selection (Contact Billing_Country = “UK”), and Subscription Plans.
Will Not Support
Enabling Direct Direct on non-subscription items
Adding subscription items as Package Items
